js
Class JSTextField

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.text.JTextComponent
                  javax.swing.JTextField
                      js.JSTextField
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener, javax.swing.Scrollable, javax.swing.SwingConstants
public class JSTextField
extends javax.swing.JTextField
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.FocusListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener

An extension to JTextField which provides a suggestion list and the ability to set a maximum entry length. Suggestions are stored in a list, and as the user types in the text field, the entered text is compared to words and phrases in the suggestion list. Any words from the list containing the string entered are displayed below the text field as suggestions. The user can then press Return to set the text field's text to the word or phrase being suggested.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Josh Sunshine
See Also:
Serialized Form

setSuggestionsEnabled

public void setSuggestionsEnabled(java.lang.Boolean state)
Turns suggestions on or off. When turned on, as the user types, a list of words and phrases containing the entered text will appear.

Parameters:
state - true to turn on suggestions, false to turn them off

getSuggestionsEnabled

Determines whether suggestions are enabled for the text field.

Returns:
true if suggestions are enabled, false otherwise

setSuggestionType

public void setSuggestionType(int type)
Sets the way text is compared to the suggestion list. JSTextField.ENTIRE_WORD matches the entered text anywhere in the suggestion list. JSTextField.BEGINNING_ONLY will only match suggestions where the start of the suggestion matches the entered text.

Parameters:
type -
